column4: Hi, I am trying to install ubuntu on an old pc, I am sitting at a prompt ubuntu@ubuntu:~$
ï»¿Hi, I am trying to install ubuntu on an old pc, I am sitting at a prompt ubuntu@ubuntu:~$    what should I type to install?
my issue was this pc was soooo old it couldent boot off cd
let me see what I get with the alt install cd
I have nothing to write to a floppy with
I had another prompt using the alt cd
the system was running win98 decently
oh... if you got to a prompt then it does support CD boot :P
can't you use the alternate install CD
maybe a lower weight linux distro would be a better idea?
what do you want to do with this system?
if it doesn't support CD boot, and you can't use floppy boot, you're kinda screwed
if the computer is that old, it won't run a new desktop like ubuntu properly
